intro: Seriphidium finitum, commonly known as the narrowleaf tansy. It is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves and yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its small, daisy-like flowers bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Seriphidium finitum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
